pages.title: Provisioning: Custom Properties, Custom Naming & Request Timeout

text_49c2a5b2.default: Specify the zones that can be used when users provision deployments in this project.
text_49c2a5b2.signpost:
Zones


A zone defines a set of compute resources that can be used for provisioning within a specific cloud account and region. You can use constraints to control placement of compute instances within the available zones.

cloudZones.label: Add Cloud Zone
cloudZones.signpost:
Provisioning Priority
A lower number means a higher priority. Default is 0 (highest).
Instances Limit
The maximum number of instances that can be provisioned in this cloud zone. Default is 0 (unlimited instances).
Memory Limit (MB)
The maximum amount of memory that can be used by this cloud zone. Default is 0 (unlimited memory).
CPU Limit
The maximum number of virtual CPUs that can be used by this cloud zone. Default is 0 (unlimited).
Storage Limit (GB)
The maximum amount of storage that the project can consume from this cloud zone. Default is 0 (unlimited storage).

text_1584741e.default: Specify the placement policy that will be applied when selecting a cloud zone for provisioning.

placementPolicy.label: Placement Policy
placementPolicy.signpost:
Placement Policy


Apply one of the following strategies:
. DEFAULT - Place compute resources in the first applicable zone.
. SPREAD - Provisions compute resources in the zone with the smallest ratio of number of VMs to number of hosts.

text_5f6b67c2.default: Specify the tags to be applied to machines provisioned in this project.

newTags.label: Tags
newTags.signpost:
Enter a new tag in either KEY:VALUE format or just with the KEY only.
Use '+' symbol to add an additional new tag.

text_008bc197.default: Specify constraints that should be applied to all requests in this project.
text_008bc197.signpost:
Constraints


Network constraints are matched with the capability tags on network profiles and subnets.
Storage constraints are matched with the capability tags on storage profiles.
Extensibility constraints are matched with the capability tags on vRealize Orchestrator integrations.
If the same constraint or the same category of constraint (e.g. location:boston and location:london) are specified in both the project and the cloud template, the constraint specified in the project takes precedence.

newExtensibilityConstraints.label: Extensibility constraints
newExtensibilityConstraints.signpost:
We can add new constraints here if the constraints you are looking for are not selectable from the 'Extensibility Constraints' field.
Format to add a new constraint
Format #1: KEY:VALUE
or
Format #2: KEY

text_cc8a9f45.default: Specify the custom properties that should be added to all requests in this project.
text_cc8a9f45.signpost:
Custom Properties


Custom properties can be used for provisioning or to capture additional metadata, for example for reporting or extensibility.
If the same custom property is specified in both the project and the cloud template, the property value specified in the project takes precedence.
Select “Encrypted” to encrypt the value of the property.

text_b88a95f0.default: Specify the naming template to be used for machines, networks, security groups and disks provisioned in this project.

text_6a6c2a89.default: Hint: Avoid conflicting names by generating digits in names. ${######}

namngTemplate.label: Template
namngTemplate.signpost:
Custom Naming Template


The specified template will substitute the auto-generated machine names. Make sure the template generates unique names for this project, otherwise the deployment may fail if a machine with the same name already exists. Here are the available properties to use:
Resource properties: includes the resource name from cloud template template, custom properties assigned to the resource (from cloud template, project, etc.). e.g. ${resource.image}, ${resource.name}
Endpoint properties: use any endpoint or custom property assigned to the endpoint e.g. ${endpoint.endpointType}
Project properties: name and description e.g. ${project.name}
User name, user: ${userName}, ${user} Number generator: add digits to generated names to make them unique. ${######} adds 6 digits.

text_33c4a8c6.default: If this project team is deploying cloud templates that need more than 2 hours to provision, you can specify an extended period before the deployment fails.

text_609d8ea8.default: If both the cloud template and the project include timeout values, the largest value takes precedence.

timeout.label: Timeout
timeout.signpost:
Request Timeout


Use d, h, m and s to set the format of the value, e.g. 1d, 2h, 3m, 59s. Leave blank (default) to not specify a preference for timeout
